remarks: The point inversion function is an involution.  Theorem 7.7 of [Schwabhauser] p. 49.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 3-Jun-2019.)
statement:
mirval.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
mirval.d $e |- .- = ( dist ` G ) $.
mirval.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
mirval.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
mirval.s $e |- S = ( pInvG ` G ) $.
mirval.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
mirval.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. P ) $.
mirfv.m $e |- M = ( S ` A ) $.
mirmir.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. P ) $.
mirmir $p |- ( ph -> ( M ` ( M ` B ) ) = B ) $.
